findings: A right lung base pulmonary cyst is unchanged compared to the prior study.
The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation throughout with no evidence of focal lesions.
The pancreas has normal attenuation throughout with no evidence of focal lesions.
The spleen shows normal size and attenuation throughout.
The kidneys are of normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram. The previously described hydroureteronephrosis on the left has resolved.
There is wall thickening and tethering from the rectosigmoid to sigmoid colon with surrounding inflammatory fat stranding, slightly more prominent compared to the prior study.

There is no evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture; degenerative changes are most extensive at L4-5 and L5-S1 with disc height loss and endplate sclerosis which has progressed since the prior study.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The previously described hydroureteronephrosis on the left has resolved. The wall thickening and tethering from the rectosigmoid to sigmoid colon is slightly more prominent compared to the prior study.
